content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem, I like it!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice change from boring clashes

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This contribution would be a nice addition. I also like that it tells something about the Japanese culture.

Goal
* "ending consonant -n" may not be an accurate description, because it may also appear in the middle of a word. Please fix the wording.

Input
* Please delete the example.

Output
* Please delete the example.

* Please format "-" as a {{constant}}.

Constraints
* I don't understand the constraint. Can it be deleted?

Cases
* Please add more pairs of cases. Currently the vowel "e" is not covered in any validators.

Thanks.

Hello, I thank you for your (constructive) comment.

I made the changes as mentionned with new test cases.

I hope it will be better these time.

Thank you for following up.

Goal
* "consonant n" is still not an accurate description. Is there any particular term for a standalone consonant n i.e. n without a vowel immediately following it?

Cases
* "basu tei" has a space character in the input string. That's not mentioned in any parts of the statement, and that's not covered in any visible test. Would you please:
either (a) replace that validator,
or (b) rewrite Input section and replace the corresponding test?

Thanks.

I changed the description for the <<n>> consonant.

I also changed the test case with the word "chokoreeto".

Suggest to change "standalone or surrounding a vowel" to "followed by a vowel or standalone".

Thank you.
I changed the formulation. I also find it clearer.
